Steps to Reproduce: 1. Navigate to Signup. 2. Enter Name: `A`. 3. Enter valid unique Email. 4. Click 'Signup'. 5. Complete form.
1. Navigate to Signup. 2. Enter Name: `[255 'A' characters]`. 3. Enter valid unique Email. 4. Click 'Signup'. 5. Complete form.
Expected Result: Registration successful. Full name displayed correctly, or gracefully truncated if a display limit exists.

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Navigate to Signup. 2. Attempt to enter Name: `[256 'A' characters]`. 3. Enter valid unique Email. 4. Click 'Signup'. 5. Complete form.
Expected Result: Input field should prevent typing beyond max length, or display a validation error. Registration should not proceed with oversized name.
Notes: Boundary Value Analysis (BVA) & Input Field Behavior

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Navigate to Signup. 2. Enter valid Name. 3. Enter Email: `[240 'a' chars]@[10 'b' chars].com`. 4. Click 'Signup'.
Expected Result: Registration successful if the email is valid and within length limits.
Notes: Boundary Value Analysis (BVA) : Email max length

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start TC_REG_001. 2. Reach 'ENTER ACCOUNT INFORMATION' page. 3. Enter Password: `abc` (less than typical 6 chars). 4. Click 'Create Account'.
Expected Result: Validation message 'Password must be at least 6 characters long' (or similar). Account not created.

Steps to Reproduce: 1. Start TC_REG_001. 2. Reach 'ENTER ACCOUNT INFORMATION' page. 3. Fill all fields, for Address 1 enter: `123 Main St!@#$%^&*()_+=[]{}|\`~`. 4. Click 'Create Account'.
Expected Result: Registration successful. Address displayed correctly with special characters.

Test Case Name: Multiple Account Creation Attempts with Temporary Emails
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use a temporary email service (e.g., mailinator.com) to get a unique disposable email. 2. Register an account using this email (TC_REG_001). 3. Repeat steps 1 & 2 quickly with a new temporary email.
Expected Result: Registration should succeed each time. (If the site blocks temporary emails or rate limits, it's a security feature.)
